page.title: 16 Charminster School.
page.content: The original school on that site was built in 1874.None of this remains, and it was replaced in 1958 by a modern establishment and then added to in 1966.The school caters for 103 children,half of them from Charminster. The other 50 or so come from Sydling St. Nicholas, Frampton,Stratton, Bradford Peverell and other small hamlets. Some of the children walk to and from the school, some travel with their parents in cars but many travel on the coaches that operate for the school. In the morning a Dorset County Council bus operates,in the afternoon two Bere Regis buses carry the children back and forth. Altogether I think it is a typical, modern primary school.
